alert.note: Alert for Barton; Benton; Cedar; Dade; Hickory; Jasper; Polk; St. Clair; Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 2:36AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Cherokee, Crawford, Hickory, Barton, Cedar, Benton, northwestern Polk, St. Clair, southern Vernon, northwestern Jasper and northwestern Dade Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 236 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lowry City to 10 miles southwest of Nevada to near Walnut. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Joplin, Pittsburg, Carthage, Webb City, Pomme de Terre Lake, Stockton Lake, Truman State Park, Prairie State Park, Pomme De Terre State Park, Stockton State Park, Truman Lake, Nevada, Carl Junction, Lamar, Baxter Springs, El Dorado Springs, Frontenac, Columbus, Galena and Girard. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 43 and 90. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for southeastern Kansas...and southwestern and west central Missouri.

area.areaDesc: Barton; Benton; Cedar; Dade; Hickory; Jasper; Polk; St. Clair; Vernon
